main event: A witness reported seeing a bright, round, metallic object that moved rapidly and silently in the sky over Woodland Hills, California on December 21, 1952.
interesting points: The object appeared to move at a terrific velocity, disappearing 'almost instantly' like turning off a light.
The object's movements were described as unusual, with abrupt changes in direction and speed that could not be attributed to a conventional aircraft.
The object was estimated to be around 20 feet in diameter and was observed for 15-20 seconds before disappearing.
No sound was associated with the object's movement.
The witness was an employee at a rocket test laboratory, providing a credible source for the report.
witnesses: an employee at a rocket test laboratory
